resources.string: This app can be used to detect different types of Skin Lesions From image just click the image or select directly from the gallery

A melanocytic naevus (American spelling ‘nevus’), or mole, is a common benign skin lesion due to a local proliferation of pigment cells (melanocytes). It is sometimes called a naevocytic naevus or just \'naevus\' (but note that there are other types of naevi). A brown or black melanocytic naevus contains the pigment melanin, so may also be called a pigmented naevus.A melanocytic naevus can be present at birth (a congenital melanocytic naevus) or appear later (an acquired naevus). There are various kinds of congenital and acquired melanocytic naevi (American spelling \'nevi\')
